Hi @priya_sshekhar, 

Option 1 - Please use the Transfer event 01 or 02 depending of your scenario. 
If you're looking to determine via a custom logic then use a Source class with relevant ABAP code logic in the transfer event mentioned above. 

Option 2 - If you are using correctly the Split criteria in the Profile of Business volume AND your CDS view capture correctly the profit center used in the source document, then your profit center should flow accordingly into the Settlement document line item. 
Please review the standard configuration guide provided by SAP in the KBA mentioned by @MichaelWerner.

https://me.sap.com/notes/2074289/E

Regards, 
Gauthier Victor

entry.title: Re: GR and stock management for WIP half cooked material...
entry.content:
Try with the below approach

Create a dedicated storage location to represent the staging area. After the first operation, post a transfer from the shop floor to this WIP location using MB1B (Movement Type 311) or MIGO. This gives you visibility of WIP stock in MMBE or Stock Overview.

Continue using PP03 for the second operation to trigger the Purchase Requisition and Purchase Order. Ensure the component assignment is correct so that the WIP material is linked to the external operation.

In the Material Master (QM View), set up QM control key for external processing. In PO, set Inspection Type 01 or 04 depending on your setup. Upon GR, SAP will generate an inspection lot which allows quality check before consumption.

Treat the WIP material as a subcontracting component in the PO. Use ME2O to monitor subcontracting stock. This way, SAP tracks the WIP material sent to the vendor and expects it back post-processing.

In the routing, ensure the final operation consumes the WIP material. This prevents premature consumption and aligns with your inspection logic.

Below is the Process flow summary

entry.title: Re: Issue with Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge in Adva...
entry.content:
In your case, the SD step fails with Copying Requirement 304, which checks for a valid Reason for Rejection. If the item is billing-relevant and the rejection reason is missing or greyed out, SAP won’t allow the SD order to copy the item. So, Billing Relevance + Missing Rejection Reason = Copying Failure.

Coming to your issue, what is your item category REN settings for "Billing Relevance" and Screen Sequence Group?

Go to vov7, select the item category used for your returns and check both the above. Make a note of those. Go to VFBS, enter program SAPMV45A and Screen Group (in standard, this is N), so that, you’ll see a list of function codes and screen sequences.

Look for the function code related to item detail (usually UER2 or UEB2). Double-click to open the screen layout. In the screen layout, locate the field for Reason for Rejection (technical name: VBAP-ABGRU). Check what status is set there. According to your post, I presume, it is set to either Display or Hidden or Suppress which should be changed to Optional. So, once you done this, assign a valid Reason for Rejection before triggering the SD step. This combination ensures SAP recognizes the item as not billable, and allows the SD order to be created successfully.

entry.title: Re: Query on Advanced Return Management for Service and N...
entry.content:
The error “Invalid Movement Type 657” occurs because:

  • Movement Type 657 is used for returns to stock in ARM.
  • Service items and NLAG items do not involve inventory postings.
  • SAP tries to post a goods movement for an item that doesn’t have stock, which leads to the error.

To answer your question whether you can use ARM for Service and NLAG Items?, the answer is NO. SAP does not support ARM flows for Service items (item category TATX) and NLAG items (non-stock items, typically item category KLN or similar)

If you need to process returns for these items, consider going with Standard Return Order (without ARM). Create a manual return order referencing the original invoice. Skip the ARM-specific flows like automatic delivery or credit memo.

Finally, if your business requires ARM-like tracking for services or NLAGs, you could create a custom item category that bypasses movement type 657. Use user exits or BAdIs to suppress inventory logic. But this requires development effort and careful testing.

entry.title: Re: Functional Area not found in TCode GR55
entry.content:
Functional Area 1000 is present in GRR2 because it's included in the report definition. However, as I said already, GR55 only displays functional areas with posted data—so if no transactions have been made using 1000, 2000, or 3000, they won’t appear in GR55 even though they’re defined in OKBD or GRR2.

Functional areas are typically assigned in the Cost Center Master (KS03), not directly in KE53. To trace them via KE53:

  • Go to KE53 → Environment → Assignments to find linked cost centers.
  • Then check those cost centers in KS03 to see which functional area is assigned.

To verify visibility in GR55, try posting a test transaction using FB50 or KB21N with one of the functional areas. After posting, re-run GR55 to confirm if it appears.

Also, ensure the report group used in GR55 includes functional area as a selection/output field—check this in GRR1.

entry.title: Mexico Union Dues
entry.content:
​In Mexico, union dues are payments made by workers to their labor unions to support union activities, administration, and collective bargaining efforts. These dues are governed by Mexico’s Federal Labor Law (Ley Federal del Trabajo) and are typically outlined in the union’s statutes and collective bargaining agreements

​

  • The amount due is set by the union itself and approved by its members; there’s no fixed national rate.
  • Dues are deducted directly from employees’ paychecks by the employer and transferred to the union

The Union fund is used often for union operations, legal representation, training, and negotiation efforts.

entry.content:
Hello @abasilis 

Thanks for sharing the screenshot. The behaviour is due to the Financial Limited license, which allows viewing Purchase Orders but does not support searching by User-Defined Fields in the Find window. That’s why the fields appear read-only.

Options

  • Assign a Professional or Logistics Limited license if a UDF search is required or use a custom query via Query Manager to filter by UDF values.

This is a license limitation rather than a system error.

License Guide for SAP Business One 10.0

Chuma

entry.title: SAP BTP ABAP Environment - Release 2508
entry.content:
SAP BTP ABAP Environment - Release 2508

With the launch of the new release 2508, this blog post delivers an in-depth overview of the newest features and improvements. The release has been available since August 16th, replacing the previous 2505 release. The highlights of the current release include: Support of CDS Table Entities as active persistence in RAP, SAP Fiori-based Multi-Dimensional Reporting or the new software delivery option for partners the "Add-On Product". 

The list of all new features can be found on the What's New for SAP BTP ABAP Environment page

All new AI features are summarized here.

ABAP Development Tools (ADT)

  • Creation of Behavior Definition for CDS Table Entities (see Table Entities and Creating Data Definitions)
  • New Icons for Fiori User Interface Editors (details)
  • Extensions to the Class and Interface: C1 Consistency and Compatibility Checks, the ATC checks API Release: Consistency of Released APIs and API Release: Compatibility of Released APIs now check for consistency and compatibility about BDEF-derived types in released classes and interfaces
  • ADT Debugger Comparison Tool for Internal Tables (details)
  • Enrichment in the Element Information Popup, you can now search for substrings within the structured display of the Element Information popup (see Editing ABAP Source Code and Analyzing CDS Objects)
  • Learning from the Key Bindings Toolbar and Highlighting Ghost Text at Keyword Completion In-Line (see Concepts: Keyword Completion and Tasks: Keyword Completion)
  • Display of Copyright Statement for ABAP Development Objects in Properties View
  • HTTP-based ADT Links for Form-Based Objects, until now, the HTTP-link support was available only for the source-code-based ABAP objects 
  • RAP Business Objects Test Double Framework: Auto-Fill CID Support for Modify EML Statement (details)
  • Working with Forms, you can create form templates using Adobe LiveCycle Designer directly in ABAP development tools for Eclipse. Form Templates can be retrieved during runtime via the class CL_FP_FORM_READER (details)
  • Working with Electronic Document Consistency Checks, you can now create and modify the consistency checks you want to perform on your business documents
  • Working with Electronic Document Consistency Representation Types, you can create and modify representation types for your business documents based on their source location. Configure these representation types within the Electronic Document Consistency framework to ensure consistency

Core Data Services

  • New CDS Views in Business Event Logging: C_BUEVLGEVTFULLPYLDJSONDEX_2: Business Event Data v2, C_BUSEVTLOGACTIVITYDEX: Business Event Activity,  C_BUSEVTLOGEVENTDEX_3: Business Event Header Data (v3)
  • Deprecated CDS Views in Business Event Logging: C_BUSEVTLOGEVENTDEX_2 (Business Event Header Data (v2) Use the following successor: C_BUSEVTLOGEVENTDEX_3 and C_BUEVLGEVTFULLPAYLOADJSONDEX (Business Event Data): Use the following successor: C_BUEVLGEVTFULLPYLDJSONDEX_2
  • CDS Hierarchy Generation Wizard, the wizard will derive potential hierarchy nodes already from the start (on the master data view) and guide you through the creation process

ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP)

  • Collaborative Draft, you can now add collaborative capabilities to your business object. The collaborative draft allows multiple users to work concurrently on the same draft instance (details)
  • Cross-BO Transactional Enablement, cross-BO scenarios can now be transactionally enabled by defining a cross-BO context for the respective BDEFs (see RAP-Operations for Associations and RAP-with Cross Associations and RAP-AssocImplType)
  • RAP Factory Actions, they now return the http status 201 instead of 200 in case of a successful OData V4 response

SAP Fiori

  • Fiori-Based Multi-Dimensional Reporting – Cloud-Compliant, you need to quickly build an analytical Fiori application, but simple list reporting doesn’t satisfy your needs? Instead, you already built an analytical model with the new embedded analytics capabilities of the developer extensibility and now want to unleash its full potential? In that case, we have the right solution for you: Without writing a single line of additional code, you can simply expose your model in a full-fledged analytical application with a modern Fiori-based UI and real multi-dimensional “slicing & dicing” capabilities
  • Fiori-Based Multi-Report Applications, you need to quickly build an analytical Fiori application, that puts multiple analytical queries into one context in a single UI? All you need to do is to provide the queries, bundle them in an InA Service and you are good to just start the brand new "Review Booklet Application" wizard to generate the application. Afterwards, you can refine the configuration of your Review Booklet in an easy to use Fiori UI
  • Fiori UIs for Communication Management Change History, it is now possible to view the communication management change history in Fiori UIs
  • Change Document Reuse UI, you can embed a reuse UI in your RAP OData V4 Fiori application (details)

Business Configuration 

  • Reduce Footprint with the existing RAP generator for business configuration maintenance objects, you can easily generate all development objects that are required for a configuration object. Since the number of objects is still quite large, optimizations in the RAP programming model have been implemented that reduce the number of required development objects and make them easier for a developer to manage 

Security

  • Business User Authentication, option for configuring secondary signing certificates, currently only basic authentication is supported as authentication for SMTP outbound communication. With this feature, also the OAuth Client Credential Grant will be supported

Business Events

  • Activate Business Event Logging, with this release, there are changes to the behavior of the configuration object. The option to select the logging of all data has been removed. By default, when you enable logging of data, all business event data will be recorded (details)
  • View Object Relationships, with this feature, you can view inbound and outbound relationships for logged objects in business event logging. You can also navigate across object components (details)
  • Log RAP-based C1 events, this feature enables the logging of C1-released, RAP-based events for local consumption (details)
  • Grouping Events as Activities, with this release, events of the same type and object occurring in the same session are grouped as activities. Sequences in the application Display Business Events by Objects are displayed according to activities. A new CDS view is also released to retrieve activity details. An activity is an action performed by a user or the system that initiates an event in the system (details) 
  • Expose Extensibility Status in Open Resource Discovery Document for Business Events, the Open Resource Discovery document for business events now exposes the extensibility status (details)
  • Success Log For Processed Events, it is now possible to configure a log for successfully processed events
  • Source Event Filter, you can now restrict the sending of events by defining filters for event topics. These filters can now also be created directly for event payload properties

Integration

  • Code Snippet in SOAP Service Consumption Model changed, the updated service consumption model improves the instantiation of consumer proxies and optimizes receiver determination through logical ports (details)

  • You can build and manage your own application interfaces in ABAP development tools for Eclipse (ADT) with the SAP Application Interface Framework (AIF). Due to the lack of ADT for AIF, the development objects for asynchronous integrations (event consumption model and asynchronous SOAP services) currently generate their corresponding AIF interfaces with default monitoring settings automatically. With new AIF development capabilities in ADT, these AIF interfaces can be customized. Custom AIF interfaces can also be created, for monitoring the background processing framework (bgPF) in ABAP Cloud, for example
  • The ABAP HTTP client and server now support server-sent events (SSE). Which allows a server to send parts of the body of the response to the client without the client having to actively request them. After being sent by the server, the client can fetch them as they become available (details)

Data Integration

  • Outbound SQL via CDS External Entities, the ADT generation wizard allows you to develop outbound SQL scenarios more efficiently by generating the required CDS external entities based on an imported CSN definition of the remote SQL API
  • SQL Service, INSERT and DELETE on Writable CDS View Entities, in data integration scenarios, users can access data in an ABAP system from an external consumer, using the SQL service and the ODBC driver for ABAP. So far, users can query data in exposed CDS view entities, and this was a read-only scenario, where SELECT statements could be used. Now, the SQL service can also be used to change data in exposed writable CDS view entities using INSERT and DELETE statements. Use cases for INSERT and DELETE in such a data integration scenario include: full replication of data from another system into the ABAP system or bringing data into staging tables that will be later used for your custom ABAP coding (details)

Reuse Services

  • Print Queue Administrator Integration, you can now create and delete print queues directly using APIs without the need to enter the Maintain Print Queues app. You can do so using the communication scenario SAP_COM_0A86 (details)

Background Processing Framework

  • Background processing is very important for business applications. A lot of logic can be executed asynchronously to improve performance. In scenarios where changes of the current LUW are to be communicated remotely, the asynchronous execution is even mandatory to be compliant with the SAP LUW (due to implicit database commits). We want to simplify and improve the background processing by covering all required qualities like: “exactly once”, “in order”, testability and an integration into the ADT cross trace for better supportability (details)

Technical Monitoring

  • SQL Statement Analysis app, with this app, you can analyze the performance and resource consumption of SQL statements within a selectable time range (details)

Lifecycle Management

  • Manage Software Components, the delete dialog for Bring Your Own Git has been modified. The Unregister repository checkbox within the dialog has been moved outside the dialog and changed to a separate Unregister button (see Delete Software Components and Bring Your Own Git)

Custom Code Migration App

  • Redesign of Fiori Space and Page Templates, the Custom Code Migration Fiori app has been split up into two separate tiles. There is now the Analyze Custom Code app for the custom code analysis use case and the Custom Code Migration app for the migration to SAP S/4HANA use case (details)

Landscape Portal

  • Delivery of an Add-On Product, if you have an SAP Partner Edge Build contract, you can now publish a product as an add-on product. This offers a second delivery option for partners as an alternative to the multitenancy SaaS solution. Your product will appear in the SAP Store, where eligible customers can install it in their own SAP BTP ABAP environment system. The Landscape Portal is used for both, to publish add-on products by partners, and to install them by the customers (details)

SAP Fiori Launchpad

  • Manage Launchpad Spaces and Pages: Redesign and Renaming, adapted overview pages to enhance working with spaces and space templates, as well as with pages and page templates. "Predefined" and "SAP-Delivered" were renamed to "Templates" to ensure consistent terminology between these apps (see Manage Launchpad Spaces and Manage Launchpad Pages)
  • New Layout for Launchpad Shell Bar and Menus (see User Menu, Shell and Shel Bar and Working with Notifications)

SAPUI5

  • Referenced SAPUI5 Version, as part of hotfix collection 4 (which is used for the standard upgrade), SAPUI5 version 1.136.4 is used for the administrator’s SAP Fiori launchpad, SAP-delivered Fiori apps, and the custom-built SAP Fiori apps, which are deployed to the ABAP system (see upgrade windows and SAPUI5)

entry.title: Re: GIRO Bank Account Setup in Ariba SLP for Sweden Supplier
entry.content:
Hello @karthiga0611 

Great question, this comes up frequently when onboarding Nordic suppliers.

For Swedish suppliers, both Bankgiro and PlusGiro accounts are supported and should be entered as follows.

Bankgiro

Country: Sweden

Bank account field: Bankgiro number

Bank key/routing number: 0000

PlusGiro

Country: Sweden

Bank account field: PlusGiro number

Bank key/routing number: 9960

This setup aligns with Swedish domestic payment practices and ensures that supplier payment details are validated correctly in Ariba and flow properly to the back-end system.

Let me know if you need further support

With Best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud - FAQs
entry.content:
@AlexShipilov - Appreciate and thank you for the question.

Moving to PCE offers several technical and functional benefits:

Scalability & SaaS Pricing: Private Cloud offers scalable infrastructure with a single subscription model (e.g., BW/BW4 included in BDC), reducing capital investment and ensuring mainstream maintenance (BW 7.5 until 2030, BW/4HANA until 2040).

Unified Data Management: Consolidating BW and S/4HANA in Private Cloud enables seamless integration with BDC services (S/4 Data Products, BW Data Product Generator, Datasphere) for harmonized reporting, BI, and AI use cases.

Improved Performance: Co-hosting BW and S/4HANA minimizes latency, enabling real-time analytics and faster decision-making.

Simplified IT & Lower TCO: Managed services reduce IT overhead, while SAP handles technical operations and upgrades on request, leveraging resilient hyperscaler infrastructure.

Hope this helps - Jeet

entry.title: Re: S/4 Public cloud - Service - Ship spare part for a se...
entry.content:
Hello @Laure_AD 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, spare parts for a service order are managed via Service Logistics integration.

  • Add the spare part (item type SVR1) to the service order → the system reserves stock.
  • Create an outbound delivery from the service order to ship the part directly to the customer.
  • If the technician cannot carry it, use a Service Part Recipient address or a Transfer Stock process to ship it separately.

This maintains the connection between the spare part shipment and the service order for planning, costs, and billing.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Cannot cast java.lang.String to org.eclipse.core.reso...
entry.content:
I tried below approach and it resolved the issue.

.1. downgraded the Eclipse to previous version. This can be done in Eclipse->help-->about eclipse IDE-->Installation details-->Installation history --> select the previous version -->click on revert button at the bottom. It will take some time

2. after downgrade, a popup came for me to change the workspace for the eclipse as the newer version is found. If i don't change the workspace, there is a warning that problem occurs or potential data loss. I created a new folder and added this folder as my eclipse workspace. 

3. Then i was able to generate ABAP repo objects and provide my package name. it worked fine.

I think the issue is after upgrade/downgrade, we have to change the eclipse workspace to make sure that every configurations works fine in eclipse. 

@Partha11 try the same and let me know if it works for you

entry.title: Re: Adding Lean Service component in the maintenance task...
entry.content:
Hello @roshan89 

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the use of Lean Services in maintenance orders and maintenance task lists within SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. The screenshots you shared were useful

This behaviour is intentional within the system.

  • In maintenance orders, you can assign Lean Services using specific item categories such as Service with SES, Service without SES, or Enhanced Limit
  • In maintenance task lists, only materials can be included in the plan, since categories for service procurement items are not supported. Therefore, your configured service item categories will not appear in the task lists.

Reason:
Task lists serve as reusable templates mainly for technical operations and material components. Items like Lean Services for service procurement need to be added later at the order level, where comprehensive logistics and procurement integration takes place.

Recommended Approach:

  • Utilise task lists to organise technical operations and materials.
  • When creating a maintenance order, add the required Lean Service items directly at the order operation stage.

This process is the standard and intended method within SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

For your reference, you may consult the official SAP Help documentation on Maintenance Orders in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and the learning video on Procuring Lean Services.

Please inform me if you require further assistance.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd in 2025
entry.content:
Hey Everyone!

SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on the 4th of November 2025, and preparations are now in full swing at SAP!

SAP TechEd is the leading tech conference for all developers, IT professionals, business experts, tech visionaries, innovators, and leaders eager to gain in-depth knowledge of SAP’s solutions, platforms, and technologies, along with insights into their future direction. It also offer an opportunity to network and connect with peers and SAP experts. 

In 2025, SAP TechEd goes hybrid, kicking off with parallel events in Berlin, Louisville, and online – followed by SAP TechEd on Tour stops in Australia, India, UK, and Germany for a unique opportunity for an in-depth, in-person learning experience. Except for the Berlin and Bangalore stops, the on-site events are organized in partnership with, and hosted by, SAP User Groups and SAPinsider. 

The choice is yours: join us on-site in Berlin or Louisville (at ASUG Tech Connect), or online for the first events in the series! 

Save the date and register now!
📅November 4 - 6, 2025
Berlin | Online (free) | Louisville

ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd in 2025

🔧 What to Expect

ABAP continues to evolve, and SAP TechEd events in 2025 are the best place to see what’s next. Beyond the integration of ABAP Cloud into SAP Build announced last year, and the integration of SAP Joule for Developers into the ABAP development tools along with the ABAP AI SK to infuse AI into your business processes earlier this year,  you’ll have the opportunity to explore the latest innovations and updates in ABAP Cloud, AI-based custom code transformation, clean core practices, and the new clean core levels approach for SAP S/4HANA extensibility in both the private cloud and on-premise.

💡 Why Attending ABAP Sessions Matters

  • Get a clear direction for your ABAP strategy, whether you're on ECC, S/4HANA, or SAP BTP
  • Learn how to modernize custom development without touching the core
  • See how SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities can support faster, cleaner development
  • Take home practical skills for RAP, testing, ABAP Test Cockpit, governance, and more

Access the SAP TechEd 2025 session catalogs:  SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual | ASUG Tech Connect.

📌ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 

📅 Event Info: 

  • Dates: November 4–6, 2025
  • Location: Messe Berlin (Berlin, Germany)
  • Session formats: Strategy talks, roadmap updates, deep dives, community talks, and hands-on workshops
  • 9 Content tracks: ABAP sessions primarily in the tracks "Application Development & Automation (AD)" and "Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP (DT)" 

🎤Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
Some experts argue there’s a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let’s get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever. Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt these changing roles. 

🎯Strategy Talks (25 minutes)

ST109 – SAP Build: ABAP Cloud Strategy | also available virtually as ST119v
The ABAP Cloud strategy as part of SAP Build and the SAP strategy go hand-in-hand. Explore in this session what this means for our major topics ABAP AI and Custom Code Transformation and how we integrate Business Data Cloud. Furthermore, learn about the ABAP IDE strategy and how we support the sovereign cloud.
Speakers: Sonja Lienard (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

ST113 – Journey to unified extensibility in SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore the strategy for extensibility across SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Learn why AI-driven development with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud is key, and how the planned harmonization will make it easier to build extensions and support the clean core. Furthermore, learn about opportunities for partners to extend SAP solutions.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Khaled Musilhy (SAP), tbd

🗺️ Roadmap Sessions (25 minutes)

AD808 – SAP Build: ABAP Cloud road map
See our upcoming innovations for the ABAP Cloud development model including Joule and the Business Data Cloud integration in context and get updates on the roadmap ahead.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

DT814 – Extensibility innovations road map for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore upcoming extensibility innovations for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Discover road maps for suite extensibility, harmonization, and partner enablement for commercial use cases. Learn more about upcoming innovations for AI-driven extensibility with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud to support your clean core strategy.
Speakers: Oren Shatil (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), External Speaker

🔍Deep Dives (45 minutes)

AD104 – Boost your  ABAP development with Joule for developers  | also available virtually as AD104v
In this deep dive session you will learn all aspects of the ABAP AI strategy, from accelerating your ABAP development, over developing custom AI scenarios, up to using Joule to transform your ABAP code.
Speakers: Simona Marincei (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP)

AD105 – Introduction to ABAP Cloud and how to get started 
ABAP Cloud is the new way of developing ABAP—fully cloud-enabled and driven by AI. It combines cloud technologies with a clear separation of SAP and custom code, and in this way revolutionizes ABAP development. Grasp the major concepts of ABAP Cloud and learn how you can upskill. Also learn about Bosch Digital’s journey to ABAP Cloud and clean core.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), External Speaker

AD201 – Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build - what's in for ABAP developers?   
In this deep dive we will highlight the importance of our strategic approach of integrating ABAP Cloud in SAP Build. Learn how you can benefit from this for Fiori App development and how the graphical modeler helps you to create ABAP CDS models conveniently. Finally, get insights into the future direction.
Speakers: Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

DT200 – Unravel the mysteries of Clean Core extensions in Cloud ERP Private 
Learn about the new, enhanced clean core extensibility concept in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. Learn about tools like ABAP Test Cockpit and RISE Dashboard, as well as guidance and best practices that help you to measure, govern, re-factor and develop your custom extensions in a clean core compliant, upgrade stable and cloud-ready way.
Speakers: Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT201 – Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP
Learn about the on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. See how you can extend standard SAP applications and manage your custom apps directly in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Get insights into latest innovations for transactional, analytical, and integration use cases, such as the extensibility AI Assistant, editable tree-views, custom queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, ABAP SQL services and more.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Oren Shatil (SAP)

🛠️ Hands-On Workshops (2 hours)

AD162 – Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities    
Learn how to develop a RAP business object while exploring Joule's ABAP AI capabilities
Speakers: Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Simona Marincei (SAP)

AD163 – Fusion Development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build
In this session we will practice fusion development of ABAP Cloud in SAP Build by creating an ABAP Cloud project from the SAP Build lobby to develop a RAP BO including a Fiori application on top.
Speakers: Ingo Braüninger (SAP), Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

AD164 – Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers    
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Join us to learn how similar development works with ABAP Cloud development model using the ABAP RESTful application programming model (RAP). ABAP Cloud is the comprehensive model for building cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default – on SAP BTP and SAP S/4HANA, both in the cloud and on-premise.
Speakers: Volker Drees (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Jürgen Reidl (SAP)

DT260 – Modernize classic extensions to clean core in Cloud ERP Private    
In this session you will practice a clean core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. You will learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP Test Cockpit, and how to use ABAP Cloud and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT261 – Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in Cloud ERP Public
Join us to discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You will learn how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch. Get practical insights through exercises and take the opportunity to ask your questions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Volker Drees (SAP), Steffen Mattes (SAP)

DT266 – Troubleshoot and Optimize ABAP Cloud Extensions in Cloud ERP 
Ensuring optimal performance and stability of your ABAP Cloud-based extensions is crucial to long-term success. Learn advanced techniques and best practices for troubleshooting and optimizing custom code in the Cloud ERP. Use powerful tools like ABAP Cross Trace to get deep insights into execution flows and resource consumption.
Speakers: Steffen Mattes (SAP), Juergen Reidl (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP)

👋Join Us

I hope this overview gives you even more reasons to join us at one of the SAP TechEd 2025 tour stops in Berlin (DE), Louisville (US), Sydney (AU), Bangalore (IN), Birmingham (UK), or Hamburg (DE) – or attend online, free of charge!

We look forward to meeting and interacting with you! 🤝  In the meantime, you can watch the replays of last year's events: ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd Virtual 2024 and ABAP Cloud at SAP's Devtoberfest in 2024. You can also have a look at the 🔥ABAP Cloud sessions at the upcoming Devtoberfest 2025, running online and free of charge from September 29 to October 24, 2025! 🤝

Stay tuned – and see you there!

entry.title: Headers missing from CAP request in handler
entry.content:
Hi All!

I'm working on a CAP service that serves content to both an HTML5 app and an MDK app. I've created a handler to pre-filter some data according to the user ID. If the user is logged in using the MDK app, I want to detect this using the header' x-forwarded-path', which should be included in the request (I implemented this in another project successfully).

But this time, using CAP 8.9.2, I see only the x-correlation-id header in any request; a lot is missing. I saw some posts about missing authorisation headers, but not all the other headers (x-*** for example). 

My packages:

    "@sap/cds": "^8.9.2",
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^8.9.1",
    "@sap/xsenv": "^5.5.0",
    "@sap/xssec": "^4.6.0",

Has anyone here been through this before?

entry.title: SAP User Experience in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Every successful business knows that an exceptional user experience is the crown jewel of their operations. Not only does it enhance efficiency and productivity, but it also fosters customer satisfaction, ultimately leading to sustained growth and success in the competitive market. 

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release introduces a range of innovative enhancements, tailored to refine user interactions and optimize business processes with the help of artificial intelligence. Let's dive into these user experience highlights that will make your business shine. 

TLDR? Check out this video made by my digital twin to get an overview of my highlights:

 


Joule for business 

Speaking of jewels, SAP’s very own AI co-pilot, Joule, introduces advanced intelligent assistance to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, allowing business users to engage with their systems using natural language for quicker and more impactful results. By integrating artificial intelligence within the system, Joule serves as a digital assistant, revolutionizing the way users navigate and utilize business applications. It eliminates technical obstacles by understanding user intent and providing contextually relevant outcomes through intuitive, conversational interactions. 

Joule for consultants 

Joule for consultants is specifically designed to speed up project delivery by offering instant access to a unique, expertly curated SAP knowledge base. This includes over 200,000 pages of documentation and content from SAP communities, helping consultants find answers quickly and saving up to 1.5 hours daily. It also features SAP-specific code intelligence, reducing code interpretation time by up to 40%. Overall, Joule can accelerate project timelines by up to 14%, cutting a typical 12-to-18-month project by 1.5 to 2.5 months. 

 

Joule for developers 

Joule for developers is integrated within the ABAP development tools to enhance productivity by aiding in faster code writing, testing, and delivery for ABAP Cloud. For environments like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, it reduces development time and effort, speeding up value realization. Key features include predictive code completion, a chat feature for natural language queries, code explanation, and support for generating and improving ABAP unit tests and test classes for CDS entities, ensuring reliable applications. 

Design updates for SAP Business Suite consistency 

Navigation has become more seamless than ever with a newly designed navigation menu that removes the extra click previously needed to reach My Home. Users can now effortlessly access their favorite apps and folders from anywhere within the platform, enhancing efficiency. Additionally, personalization through "All Spaces" further improves ease of use. The introduction of the new shell bar maximizes vertical space while prominently displaying the product name. This update needs to be activated using "/UI2/SHELL_BAR_TOGGLE." Please note that adjustments may be necessary for automated testing. The user menu has been overhauled for greater intuitiveness, featuring larger images, improved spacing, and an easily accessible sign-out button. Notifications have also been refined for better management, allowing users to sort by date or importance with clear categories such as "Today" and "Yesterday." Finally, visual enhancements in Search and Error handling bring a modern touch to the interface, providing users with a smoother and more guided experience. 

Recap feature on My Home 

Moving on to user-centric improvements, the Recap feature is all set to transform how business users stay updated with their My Home enhancements. With a focus on saving time, this intelligent feature highlights the changes since the user’s last login by comparing current data with the past 24 hours. It brings tasks needing attention right to the forefront, streamlining decision-making and increasing productivity by allowing users more time for strategic work. 

Manage News app on My Home 

Meanwhile, the Manage News app strikes at the heart of timely communication. It centralizes internal messages and key updates by enabling the creation and dissemination of news articles directly on My Home. Here, administrators can control visibility, categorization, and the targeted audience of news content, facilitating consistent and streamlined communication across teams. This leads to greater connectivity and informed decision-making within the workforce. 

 AI-assisted UX features

In my last blog post, I introduced some of our AI-assisted UX features, which aim to enhance user interactions by making them more intuitive and efficient through AI-driven capabilities. With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, these AI-assisted UX features are now generally available! We structure them in base features and premium features: 

  • Base features:
    1. AI-assisted enterprise search (available through beta testing in 2502 release): Users can access business data efficiently via natural language queries, enhancing productivity and user experience. Enabling this search feature allows employees to dig through data with queries such as “Show me sales orders in overall status in process" or "Show me open sales orders that have a net value greater than 100 EUR”, offering seamless data discovery.


       
    2. AI-assisted easy filter (available through limited promotion in 2502 release): This feature elevates your user experience by allowing filters through natural language, reducing time spent on manual input. Users can enjoy intuitive interactions and explore complex filters with criteria such as currency or date range all supported by generative AI. Access to recent and favorite queries further optimizes user interactions. 


    3. AI-assisted smart summarization (also available through limited promotion in 2502 release): It simplifies data presentation through rich text summaries of object pages. This allows for better business data understanding and efficient sharing across productivity platforms, ensuring smooth collaboration between co-workers and customers. 

       


Kick start your AI journey as an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customer or partner by using the base AI-assisted features at no additional costs. The only required action from your side is the acceptance of SAP AI terms for base AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (by one S-user of your company). Afterwards, we will reach out to you with a confirmation of the activation and send over the required, minimal, “last mile configuration” on your side. 

  • Premium features:
    1. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for insights cards (available through beta testing in 2502 release): Personalizing your My Home receives a smart upgrade through generative AI, adding insights cards directly with a mere click. It supports various SAP Fiori applications, offering previews for data consistency ensuring quality. 

       


And, as we cannot get enough of our AI-assisted UX, we have some more features waiting for you in beta testing in this release as well! 

  • AI-assisted smart solutions for situations on My Home: This feature enhances task efficiency by intelligently adapting the interface for rapid situation resolution. Leveraging AI-driven insights directly from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition homepage, users gain easy access to essential information and actionable steps. This innovation fosters a seamless user experience, reducing the time and effort required for decision-making.

      
  • AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications: You can leverage AI to efficiently incorporate applications through natural language instructions. It allows users to preview and select AI-recommended applications swiftly, significantly enhancing the setup process. This feature is particularly useful for new users, making their interaction with the platform smoother and more intuitive.


  • AI-assisted easy fill: This innovation revolutionizes form completion by using natural language input to automatically map text to appropriate fields, minimizing navigation time and errors. This results in improved accuracy and efficiency in data entry, as users can maintain focus and streamline processes without tedious form-checking. 


  • AI-assisted error explanation: This feature aids in understanding and solving errors within SAP Fiori applications by delivering AI-generated resolution suggestions embedded within the error messages. This facilitates quicker problem-solving and enhances user understanding, particularly for newer users needing guidance on error resolution. 

Our beta testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition offers early access to new features and innovations, allowing users to experience enhancements firsthand and give feedback to shape the final product. Participants play a key role in influencing development to ensure it meet practical business needs, creating a collaborative link between developers and users for continuous improvement. Want to be part of this journey? Sign up for the beta testing here: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#campaign/3910  

Collaborative ERP: To-Dos in Microsoft Teams 

Speaking of collaboration, the To-Dos functionality within Microsoft Teams gives users the ability to receive notifications of new tasks directly within their activity feed, enhancing responsiveness and efficiency. This integration facilitates seamless approval processes, allowing end-users to act on situations swiftly, whether it be within Microsoft Teams or directly through SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This aims to streamline workflows, support decision-making based on real-time data, and improve team connectivity by centralizing task management within familiar interfaces.

These enhancements in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 are designed not only to transform but also to ignite the user experience, bringing an elegant polish to the platform that goes beyond traditional bounds. 

Find out more about SAP User Experience in this blog series by Thomas Reiss. 

Want to learn more about Artificial Intelligence? Check out these blog posts by Yannick Peterschmitt and Sang Dao. Refer to this document for more information. 

📽️ Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series!  

From July 21-25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. You will find the recording and presentation for SAP User Experience as well as 20 other topics of interest. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand–anywhere, anytime.  

🔎 Find all our assets

entry.title: Is there any provision available in Cloud to keep track of Unloading/Loading activities?
entry.content:
As per the Business requirement, we need to keep track of Unloading/Loading activities during Inbound/Outbound operations within EWM.

We don't see any provision in Cloud as we have in On-prem, could you please check and let us know if there are any possible approaches followed to fit this requirement into EWM.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Is there any provision available in Cloud to keep tra...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, we have some limitations comparing with On prem system on the tracking of loading and unloading. However, there are some approaches that I would like to share in case could be helpful for your business:

1. Advanced Shipping and Receiving Process
The Advanced Shipping and Receiving process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud allows for integrated, end-to-end tracking of unloading and loading activities. This process supports mixed and multi-warehouse scenarios within one freight order, coordinating steps from the arrival of trucks at the gate to the final goods movement in the warehouse.

2. Handling Execution Status
You can set handling execution statuses such as ‘Arrived’, ‘Checked In’, ‘Checked Out’, and ‘Departed’ for transportation stages and locations. These statuses help track the progress of unloading and loading activities.

3. Warehouse Management Integration
Warehouse Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud provides real-time transparency into managing and processing material movements. You can map your warehouse in detail, down to storage bin level, and plan and perform movements within the warehouse, including goods receipt and goods issue.

4. Use of Unloading Points
Unloading points can be specified in the customer master record, allowing you to schedule goods receiving hours and propose delivery dates based on the customer’s factory calendar and goods receiving schedule.

5.  Loading Using Radio Frequency

In Advanced Shipping and Receiving, you can also process loading activities using a radio frequency device (RF device), with loading by delivery, loading by door and loading by freight order.

For more detailed processes and configurations, you may refer to the SAP documentation on Warehouse Management and Transportation Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

Transportation Management (TM) - Warehouse Integration
Load Freight Orders in Advanced Shipping and Receiving
Warehouse Management - Warehouse Management
Loading Instruction
Master Data - Unloading Points
Loading Using Radio Frequency
In case those options are not enough for your business or there is something specific on the on prem system that you requires in the Public Cloud system, we truly recommend raising this request to our product owners by a feature request in our SAP Influence Portal (##2963059 - How to Submit Feature Requests for SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Product).

entry.title: Driving Resilience Through Intelligent Supply Chain Orchestration
entry.content:
In today’s global economy, supply chains are under greater pressure than ever before. Shifting trade regulations, evolving geopolitical landscapes, labor shortages, and rising customer expectations are driving unprecedented complexity. Many organizations are realizing that traditional, siloed approaches to supply chain management are no longer enough to remain competitive—or to simply keep pace with disruption.

The stakes are high: one weak link can set off ripple effects across operations, manufacturing, logistics, and customer delivery. For businesses that rely on complex supplier networks and face unpredictable market dynamics, resilience can’t be an afterthought, it must be designed into the supply chain itself.

That’s where supply chain orchestration comes in. Rather than focusing on isolated improvements within functional areas, orchestration integrates processes, data, and decision-making across the entire value chain. With the right strategy, companies can transform supply chains from reactive networks into connected ecosystems that anticipate shifts, adapt rapidly to disruptions, and deliver on customer promises.

To help you explore how orchestration creates more effective and future-ready supply chains, SAP, HP, and Accenture are hosting a  webinar designed for supply chain and operations leaders.

The session will showcase the opportunities orchestration brings to organizations across industries, and offer practical ways to:

  • Improve agility and mitigate disruption with aligned, end-to-end processes
  • Enhance visibility and execution for faster, smarter, AI-supported decisions
  • Strengthen coordination with suppliers and partners while building a foundation for scalable, proactive operations

Join my guests:

  • Antoine Colin, Senior VP, Supply Chain Transformation and Resilience, HP
  • Sid Gudal, Managing Director, Partner, Accenture
  • Sudy Bharadwaj, Global VP, Strategic Engagements, Intelligent Spend and Business Networks SAP

Driving Resilience Through Intelligent Supply Chain Orchestration

Tuesday, September 02, 2025

entry.title: Re: 🔐 Strengthening SAP BTP Security: SSO with Cloud Connector Using Token-Based Auth (Replacing SU
entry.content:
Hi @MatthiasL ,

Considering below scenarios:

  • Segregation of Duties and restricted privileges to different teams. If you see the screenshots, you will observe that i am using Trust Config "Custom Identity provider for Applications" - IAS for authentication, What it means is It's a subaccount level trust configuraiton (Not the Platform SSO). Which implies that the user CloudConnectorAdmin which i used will never be able to login to BTP cockpit and see the configurations in BTP subaccount ->cloud connector section to download the authentication data file. 
    • Permissions(cloud connector administrator) are also provided against this identity provider only. Even if let's say some customer has platform SSO enabled and luckily same user is used to login to BTP cockpit. Subaccount will still not be visible because of the permissions which are granted on Custom IDP for Apps and not on Platform SSO IDP(which will be used to login to BTP).
    • We can restrict privileges of users to perform specific tasks. In this scenario CloudConnectorAdmin can perform the connectivity , renew certificates and still don't have any access in BTP subaccount(because it can't login using these creds to BTP)..
  • This option was introduced in Cloud Connector 2.17.0  version. There are a lot of customers using older versions of cloud connector and don't have this option.

However its a valid point and this option also helps avoiding SUSER ID option so i have updated the blog with a small section to show this option as well - "Configure using authentication data from file"

Regards

Sushil Gupta

entry.title: Re: Serial Number in Storage Bin Location
entry.content:
Hello @Charisma_fitra 

Legacy stock lacking serial numbers cannot be converted.

To separate it, you can either:

  • Move it into a different storage location to keep it apart from new SN-managed stock, or
  • Post a goods issue and then re-receipt it with serial numbers.

This ensures clear separation between old and new stock.

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma
